author: awmacp
content: I realise I didn't correctly describe what I'm looking for. Does anyone know any work on the incentive structure for optimistic rollups? Specifically the incentives for producing fraud proofs and possible attack vectors. In the papers I've seen, the subject is only treated very lightly, if at all.

author: jadler2664
content:
You're asking a leading question, which is a big no-no if you want to get to the truth! The verifier's dilemma only exists in academia. Thousands of full nodes are running for Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, etc., and all without direct in-protocol incentive.

The incentives for verifying the rollup chain and producing fraud proofs really aren't complicated in practice. See section "Fast Withdrawals: Liquidity Providers" here: https://ethresear.ch/t/trustless-two-way-bridges-with-side-chains-by-halting/5728/

author: awmacp
content: How is it a leading question? I'm asking if anyone has written about a subject. Yes, it is academic.
